column1: From this point forward, you will not use the bathroom. We need to keep our starting weights high so we can lose more.
No, no, no. This is your last meal. There will be no leftovers.
There. Take those home to your wife.
Michael, its time.
Hit the scales, everybody. Right on that black platform. This way. Step it up.
Wait a minute. One more bite of eclair each. Hold it in your mouth if you cant swallow.
Wait a minute. Pam is on the scale.
Family only.
Fax this for me.
Its not gonna take her 10 minutes to fax it, Jim.  If I dont see you again, goodbye. Well, actually, Ill see you when you give me the fax confirmation, so never mind.
Ahh. We done good in there, half pint.
Monkey.
Lets do this thing.
OK, can you turn the girl off please? Im trying to get some work done.
Come on, Bernard.
All right, were set.
Shotgun weddings.
Obesity-caused illnesses.
Michael, we have a situation.
They should not be in that room.
Yeah!
Not that guy who murdered his mother. He was not so handsome. Also Kevin.
Partys over. You are so busted!
Happy Birthday, Stanley!
Attention!  Attention!  We only have a few weeks left.    And most of you are just as fat as the day we began.
I am hardly the problem, Jim.
This is what Im gonna do.  Im gonna randomly select three names and these three people will get liposuction.  Uhhhhh Stanley, Phyllis, Kevin.  And you will be responsible for your own medical bills.
Hello Phyllis.  Do you have a minute?  Listen.  Im really sorry... about what I said before.  Ok?  I was way out of line.
But you know what, I want to make it up to you.  There is a sure fire sale, but its a two man job.  Interested?
Sixty - forty.  Hm?   Ill drive.
Hey, hey!
And you burned over a thousand calories walking home.  And this branch just got a little bit closer to winning the contest.  Phyllis Vance, ladies and gentlemen!
Yeah, I took your purse.  What are you worried about?    You look great.  I can definitely see the difference.
No, no, no, it goes, it goes... look, "I say, I say, I say, Ill sit on you!"
Vamping.
Eh, Ive been sitting all day.
She should thank me.
I apologize for creating a ruse which forced you to exercise.
We better.
Yes, you do.
I do not!  I do not say "Hi" Pam!
What are you writing about me?
Im gonna write you both up for not working.
Ok, well played.  Neither of usll write the other up for not working.
God.  Where is Jim?
What are you smiling about there smiley pants?  Youre late.
Dripping on me.
Shes not a virgin, you know.
I got it, I got it.
Yes.
What should we be working on while you guys are talking?
Its a trick question.  The bread is poisoned.  Also, its not your real family.  Youve been cuckolded by a stronger, smarter male.
Time thief.  Time thief!  Fire him!
Never!
What are you doing?
Oh, so wait a minute, youre going to time me every time I yawn?  Thats absurd.  Really?  Oh hey look, monkey knows how to use a stopwatch everybody!  Hes ti---
There is no way that that was---
Ok.
None of your business.
Fine.
Yes, maybe Im not.
Hey Michael?
Contractions are coming every ten minutes.
My cervix is ripening.
Michael! My waters breaking!
Aaaaaaaa! What do you do? What do you do?
Right. Highways or surface roads?
No, Gibson is covered in potholes.  Your car breaks down. Adapt!
Its about adapting to the circumstances.
No. OK, no.  Im crowning!  Im crowning!  Aaaaaaaa!
The pressure!  The pressure!
Aaaaaaaa!
Babies are one of my many areas of expertise.  Growing up, I performed my own circumcision.
Hold me!
Cradle my head!
Im screaming, Im screaming, Im screaming! Aaaaaaaa!
Numb me up. I want anesthesia!
No! I dont want natural!
OK!
Aaaaaaaa!
Do you have the Sharpie?!
Do you have the Sharpie?!
OK!  When the baby emerges, mark it secretly in a kind of a mark that only you could recognize and no baby snatcher can ever copy.
Ready?!
Aaaaaaaa!
Butter. Newborns are slippery.
Whos Sarah Kayacombsen?
Oh no...
Jan had the baby and Michael wasnt there to mark it.  So the baby could be anybodys.  Except Michaels.
Huh. Twelve hundred dollars for a stroller? Phhhbt.
Twelve hundred dollars is what I spent on my whole bomb shelter.  For that kind of money, this stroller should be indestructible.
Dont hit the fence.  Oh no, my child!
Dont get stuck on the barbed wire!
Playtime is over!
I like to call this... the bumper test.
Oh.  I took the liberty of putting it in your trunk.
You set a date?
A knife.
You got a better way?
About what?
I know none of that. If I did, youd be the last to know.
She introduced me to so many things. Pasteurized milk, sheets, monotheism, presents on your birthday, preventative medicine.
I was talking to myself.
I just dont get it.
Why is she marrying Andy?
Thats really fattening.

Bravo, Watson. Looks like a classic seven-man job. Okay, security tapes were stolen, Motives-financial, or possible, vintage HP computer collectors. Hank down at security had clocked out. And thats all we have.
Ugh.
Get in.
I know she loves me, Phyllis. I am sure of it. She practically told me so.
Are you sure thats going to work?
Wait, this isnt our floor. Dwight...
Listen to me close. Cause Im only gonna say this once. You either break off your engagement with that singing buffoon, apologize, and then date me, or you can say good-bye to this.
I said I was only gonna say this once. You have until 614 PM. 614!
Hey Phyllis, someone let the air out of your tires. Come quick.
I had to get your attention. This is an emergency.
Listen, she ignored my ultimatum. Now what?
Okay, fine. Ive moved on. Now how do I get her back?
Wait, thats it? Thats your advice? I thought you had some kind of big master plan.
Oh. I get it. Youre trying to secure your place as head of the party-planning committee. Youre just being selfish.  And you slap like a girl.
What did Phyllis do wrong? Ill tell you what Phyllis did wrong. She stuck her nose into my business and tried to help me.
300 and one penny.
350 and one penny.
400 and one penny.
500 and one penny.
700 and one penny.
Eh, its not worth it.
Hm mm mm mm. Want to see a magic trick? Heh heh heh! Im gonna make a pencil disapp-- oh!  Disappear.
Good morning temp.
Thought Id go casual today. Morning everyone. Good morning.  Hello.  How are you Phyllis?
Andy.
No I get it. I totally understand. And uh, I just want to assure you, that I mean no disrespect. You see, Im applying!
Well if somebody who barely out-sells Phyllis, can get in, I should be fine.
I meant that as a compliment to you Phyllis, as well as a slight to Andy.
Cornell is a good school, and I want to better myself through higher education. If it makes Andy angry, so be it.
Hey there. So uh, how do you think were gonna do against Penn this year? Nathan Fords arm looks pretty strong.
Not so. Cornell is an excellent school. Without its agricultural program, we probably wouldnt have cabbage. At least not modern cabbage.
Someday, well both get together in Comstock Hall and just laugh about all of this.
Excuse me?
Andy, lets just talk about this man-to-man, after work.
What do you say?
Andy, Ive been meaning to ask you, which a cappella group should I join? The Harmoniacs, or the Do-Re-Mi-Gos?
Thats a conflict of interest.
Interview.
What?
Okay.
Bring it.
Dale Raymond Corson!
Hmm, interviewing skills, sub-par.
On the contrary, Im helping Cornell. By evaluating their interviewers.
Well, when they get my evaluation well see if theyre interested.
"Interviewer is threatening applicant with an arbitrary review process."
"Interviewer has suspect motives."
"Interviewer has turned off applicants interest in Cornell, and they are going to go to the vastly superior Dartmouth." Ever heard of it? I think I have everything I need.
And you will be hearing from the -
-Cornell Application Department,
And you will not be pleased with the result.
And your affiliation with Cornell -
Will end completely!
That is all sir, you may go.
Where did you get those?
I see what you are doing. But I do not know where you are going with this.
Cornell.
I heard someone got engaged, you dog, huh?
Oh, nothing can hurt you now. Youre a man in love!
Bring it on.
Sorry.
What does it say?
Thats impossible.
I sell more paper than anyone.
Wait, is this a joke? Im getting that queasy feeling that sometimes accompanies jokes.
No, but thats sometimes part of it.
Impossible to say. I cant see myself.
What are you mumbling about?
None of your business.
Those cant be my scores, Jim. For your information --
Im being sabotaged.
And Im going to find that person and punish them.
Youre an idiot.
No way.
I didnt say anything
What do you think I am saying to you?!
Ive caught Jim talking to himself several times today. What a loser. Get a friend, loser.
All right, fine.  Brrring.
Hello, this is Dwight Schrute from the Dunder Mifflin Paper Company.
Excellent, then you are in luck, because we are having a limited-time offer only on everything.
What is your name, sir?
Really, thats your real name?
Yes, Michael.
What? No, but I --
Oh, no. Whats wrong?
Sorry, Mr. Buttlicker. As I was saying, were having a limited--
OK, as I was saying, right now we are having --
OK, our prices have never been lower.
...never been lower!
Buttlicker! Our prices have never been lower!
He --
Please, Mr. Buttlicker --
Please give me another chance. Mr. Buttlicker.
I have to put you on with my boss.
Yeah!
You are the master.
Dont do it, Michael.
Get in!
Get in!
Shh.  They might be listening to us.
They might be listening to us
Customer service might be monitoring this conversation.
You never know. Better safe than sorry.
Who stands to benefit from our downfall?
Could be the mob. But then Dunder-Mifflin would need to be a front for money laundering, and theres little evidence of that.
I dont know. Two, maybe three if one wears out. How many shoes do you need?
Who are you talking to?
Shes not here, Jim.
Wait, shut up.
Shh. Do you hear that?
Breathing. Is that you?
Well, stop. Hold your breath. I still hear it. Whos there? Kelly, is that you? Hold on.
Ha!
Hear anything interesting?
I think you know.
What are you up to, girl? Huh? Phyllis put you up to this? Stanley? Are they paying you?
Of course I am. I know youre the mastermind, but youre too stupid to do it by yourself.
Ah!
OK.
The reason that I got bad customer reviews is because I didnt! There is a massive conspiracy going on here, and I know youre involved.
No.
No. Why? No.
Oh, man, I knew it. Who are her co-conspirators?
Obviously. I knew it.
Yeah. What?
I was -- I was right.
I was right.
I knew it.
I knew it the whole time, buddy!
Yeah! Woo-hoo!
I knew it! Yeah! Ha-ha! Woo!  Boom! Kelly the whole time. Lets get her.
Let me paint you a picture of a little girl from southern India, who despite being welcomed into this country will now spend the rest of her life in prison for a crime she did commit.
Oh, come on. You juked the stats, cupcake.
We have our confession. Im calling security.
I want to be here when you fire her ass.
Is that the Matsuhashi B-400? The worlds tiniest Bluetooth?  May I?
Congratulations on choosing Schrute Farms for your wedding.
Well, then. Why dont you look over some of our materials?

While I describe to you the Excalibur package. In addition to the breathtaking natural beauty and smell of Schrute Farms, I can promise you that our grounds can be catered to fit your exact specifications.  I will work tirelessly for you over the coming months and be at your constant disposal.  Please feel free to call or stop by, any time of the day or night.
While you, my good friend, have nothing more to worry about. This wedding is officially out of your hands.
OK.
You already said deal.
Wait, why do you need three suitcases?
Do you have your money belt?
No, no, no, no, no.  You want to wear that puppy right up on the breastbone like a bra.
Here, let me help you.
Do you want to get robbed in a foreign country? I wash my hands of this.
Who is that monkey?
Know what?
Oh, well, doesnt surprise me.
Have you seen her painting, Jim? The building? There are shadows coming from two different directions.
What? Are there two suns?
Last I checked, thats not an office building in the Andromeda galaxy.
Its totally unrealistic.  There are no lines in the parking lot.
Youre back.
Good. I need you to make five copies of these.
Alright. First thing in the morning then.
Brownies is it? Hm. Pastry cubes made of sugar and fat? No thank you, Ill stick with my jerkie.
To socialize.  And inform.
He looks great.
Well rested.
Also, its icky back there.
Okay, fireable offenses include workplace violence and sexual harassment.
I love catching people in the act.  Thats why I always whip open doors.
Okay
I am the bait.
Men find me desirable.
Oh, its a good day too. Im wearing my mustard shirt.
Mmhmm.
Men find me desirable.
Those are fighting words.
I hope he doesnt haul off and just hit you.
Hmmm?
Come on.  Baaah!
Hit him!  Hit him, Chicken.
Ryan.  Come on, man?
Punch him as hard as you possibly can in the face.
Are you really not going to punch him?
I thought you were going to parcel those out through the day
Theres still one thing we could do to get Toby fired.
Frame him, for using drugs.
Yeah, its illegal, but... everything they do on The Shield is illegal.
Oh Ive framed animals before.  I framed a raccoon for opening a Christmas present.  And I framed a bear for eating out of the garbage.

Yes, I repeat a drug dealer is on the premisis of Dunder Mifflin.  His name is Toby Flenderson  and he recently returned from a mysterious vacation in Central America.   I have risked a great deal to tell you this information.  My name is Andy Bernard.  Andrew Bernard, thats my name.  See you soon.
Hey, Pam. Hey I got this, okay?  Hello, officers, Dwight Schrute, former volunteer Sheriffs Deputy.  Listen, I may have inside information that someone is hiding drugs in this very office.
Officers, I reveal to you the perpetrator.
Search his things.
They dont need your permission, Flenderson, theyve got the companys permission.
Save your whining for the jury there, Flenderson.
No! Michael, no!
So wait a minute, theres no drugs?
Gahh, dammit!  Come on!
Wait, officers, are you sure you dont want to interrogate him?
You have laws that protect you in any kind of interrogation.  Why dont you use them?

What is my perfect crime?  I break into Tiffanys at midnight.  Do I go for the vault? No, I go for the chandelier.  Its priceless.  As Im taking it down, a woman catches me.  She tells me to stop.  Its her fathers business.  Shes Tiffany.  I say no.  We make love all night.  In the morning the cops come and I escape in one of their uniforms.  I tell her to meet me in Mexico but I go to Canada.  I dont trust her.  Besides, I like the cold.  Thirty years later, I get a postcard.  I have a son and hes the chief of police.  This is where the story gets interesting I tell Tiffany to meet me in Paris, by the Trocadero.  Shes been waiting for me all these years; shes never taken another lover.  I dont care, I dont show up. I go to Berlin.  Thats where I stashed the chandelier.
Yeah, do tell.
Mmhmm.
How could it be more clear?
Okay.
Well dig a trench. As long as its downhill from the well, we should be fine.
Well were not gonna put out stumps, come on.
This is where youll have your receiving line. Of course well clear out all the livestock and hay and such.
Youre gonna need to be more specific.
Manure covers up the small of the slaughterhouse.
You wanna eat, dont you?
...Ill consider it.
Theres a hose out back.
Have you made a decision on the butter sculpture?
Okay. Cow, goat or sheep. Its not that hard.
Cats dont make butter.
It doesnt make any sense.
Cow, goat or sheep.
Heres another place.

So... why dont we try this out, well see what would happen. Give it a little test drive, what do you say? You pretend to be Angelas father, you will play Angela, and uh, I will pretend to be you. That way you can see what it looks like when youre up here.
He doesnt understand a word youre saying.

Although born just minutes from here, he speaks only German. Closed society. So, now, after the readings by all of your sisters, we will arrive at the vows. So, Konrad...  And away we go. This is a little taste of the ceremony, if you will. Hes explaining why were here, what were doing here, making introductions, blah blah blah... Then hes gonna have Andy repeat a bunch of stuff. Hes gonna ask Andy to produce a ring. I have uh, now just uh... just some twine for our purposes, and you will put the ring on her finger. Yadda yadda, then hes going to ask Andy, uh, if he would like to marry Angela. And you will reply, "I do."  And then hes going to ask Angela if she would like to marry Andy, to which you will reply...
And there we go. Okay, and thats just about it. Man and wife.
I know you did. And thats why I have taken care of everything.
Well Monkey, hes a real minister. And you said, "I do." And I said, "I do." And Andy wasnt signing a receipt; he was signing our marriage certificate as a witness.
Yes, of course it does.
It does in the state of Pennsylvania.
Haha, Mrs. Schrute.
Wha...
My... Its not my fault you dont understand German; Ive been telling you to take it for years!
What is this?
Youre so pathetic.  How long did this take you? Three hours?
Yeah, no such thing.  They dont give out black belts for things that are stupid.   Well, I hope it was worth it, cause Im gonna take it apart in about five minutes.
Really? If I can skin a mule deer in less than ten minutes, I ought to be able to cut my --
These are not dolls, Jim.  These are commodities.  Same as gold or oil.

Every year I do research to determine which toy will be the most popular of the Christmas season.  This year its a doll. Half girl, half unicorn.  Catchphrase "My horn can pierce the sky".  Pathetic. I bought out every store in the area over the last couple of weeks.  And as lazy parents become desperate I will sell them for an enormous profit.  Isnt that right princess?

I am simply punishing those parents that would wait till the last minute to get their child a gift.  And such a genetically improbable one.  Look at that.  How does that happen?  King has sex with a unicorn?  Man with a horn has sex with a royal horse?
They are now.
All right.
Oh, so glad I could help.
Merry Christmas.
Fa-la-la-la-la-la-la-ka-ching.
We got a live one!  On fire!!
Aye.
No, I like Meredith.

Actually, I dont care for Meredith, but I dont believe in this kind of thing.  In the Schrute family we believe in a five fingered intervention.  Awareness, education, control, acceptance and punching.
I stab her in the brain with a wooden stick.
There are several ways to kill a zombie, but the most satisfying one is to stab it in the brain with a wooden stick.
Oh, as fire marshal I would have to.
She is a hazard to the other people of the office.
I suppose I could do it if it was a controlled burn in a well ventilated area.
Oh right, thatll take a couple of weeks.
Really?
Oh, thats my last one.
Not my problem.
Well dont look so surprised.
Aah!
Yes!
I was just jogging.
Wait, what?  You cant take what?
No. You cant do that. It shouldnt come from you.
Seems like you already know where.
Trade seats with me.
Ive got a better angle on Pam. I can see everything.
I need a soup spoon.

Rule 17 dont turn your back on bears, men you have wronged, or the dominant turkey during mating season. There are forty rules all Schrute boys must learn before the age of five.  Learn your rules. You better learn your rules. If you dont, youll be eaten in your sleep.
Youve got to tell Andy about us.
Get it over with. Then we dont have to hide anymore.
Do you love me or not?
Because youre engaged to Andy.
Not yet.
Angela said she was going to tell him. Shes just not ready.
I dont know.
Yes.
Eager.
And flexible.
Michael, once this gets out... I dont know how its going to go down.
Might get ugly.
Have a good trip.
If Im sitting, I cant disable his neck or his groin.
If Im sitting, I dont have the option to.
Andy.
Oh good. She broke up with you.
Uh, no way. I am not giving up.
No I dont.
Well I dont know about that, because she certainly seems to enjoy making lovemaking with me.
Will never be her name.
I dont think so.
And Im telling you that I will never back down.
Oh really? How are you gonna do that?
That is very general, and does not scare me in the slightest.
Okay, fine! Good! A duel! The winner gets Angela.
Fine!
What is your weapon?
Hey, this is none of your business.
Yes!
Outside of work.
None of your business then.  Good. So what weapon?
That is stupid. I will use a sword and I will cut off your bare hands.
I will also be talking my break at the exact same time and in the same location.
Mm.
Howd that get there?
Come on! Where are you? Lets do this thing! Come on! Come on out!
Come on!
Where are you?

Come on, coward! Where are you? Where...  "From the desk of Andrew Bernard."  A note. Pathetic. "Dear Dwight, by now you have received my note. How are you? I am well. You are no doubt wondering why I have left this note. It has come to my attention that in any physical match with you, I would surely be bested." True. "The soft underbelly of my refined upbringing is my soft underbelly..."
Alas, after much consideration and deliberation...
Whoa! What are you! Hey! Hey!
Come on! Ow! Ah! Aah!
Never!  Get out and face me like a man!
Youre not a man! You dont know how to take care of her!  All you do is dress fancy and sing.  "La la la la la la la la la la!" What does that mean? You cant even protect her!
Last year, idiot!
No. My right ones falling asleep a little bit.
Yeah, back off. This isnt your fight. Oh, how much is this gonna cost?  Oh! What? Trust fund will take care of that!
I sa-
Sasquatches are the strongest animal on the planet! So fine, call me a Sasquatch!
What?
Shes sleeping with you?
She said she was only sleeping with me.
Whats this?
Hmm. It wasnt here before.
Yours doesnt.
No, its going in a different direction then the other wires.
What if the owner of Prince Family Paper has a beautiful daughter and we have to seduce her in order to get their secrets?
No, I wanna seduce her.
Please Michael, please.
Youll fall in love with her.
Okay, lets go over the plan again.
Your fictitious name?
I am a paper salesman looking for a new job. I find out everything about their expenses and salaries.
Then we meet at the Dennys...
...and then we compare notes.
No!
You know how I feel about IHOP.
Are you socialist?
Ill have a cup of a coffee.
Store only has three employees.
It means they are not expanding.
No.
No because their sign is centered perfectly above their store. No sign of the sign being moved.
Its lunch time, and no sign of anyone coming in or out. Which means they are not taking new customers out to lunch.
Which Means theyre not acquiring new business. So once again no growth.
Oh, it would if they were all cumulous and not cirrostratus.
Get your clouds right.

So you go in now, I am going to go in exactly ten minutes. We have never met each other. We are complete strangers. Also, we are going to need a signal to bolt out of there if there is danger. Lick ur lips, try it.  No, no like this.  Good.
Yeah.
Hello, I would like to apply for a job.
Why dont you just get rid of this guy?

Im your son now; you can visit him on holidays. Dwight Schrute, Im a paper salesman at a second tier paper company called Dunder Mifflin.  Im the top salesman there and Im looking for a new challenge. I would say you guys have what, 40 high full volume clients?
Pshaw, thats nothing. Ive 90 clients myself. You had better look out, someone might run you out of business.
Me too.
My boss, his insensitivity might border on cruel. This is a man who does not listen to the needs his underlings.
Its going very well.
Excuse me sir, I took the bus here and was wondering if I could catch a ride home with you in your car.
Thank you very much.
Thank you for your time I look forward to getting your calls.
Cmon.
All their top clients I cant believe it.
Someones looking out the window. Go go, Peel out, go.
You drove over that. Go back
Thats not good.
Oh my God.
Oh man,
Not good.
Yeah.
Youve done more then you can possibly know.
He drove over the divider and then backed over it and caused the..
How much longer is this going to take?
This is disgusting, what is it this, instant?
I look forward to hearing from you about that job application.
Goodbye prince family,  should be called the Sucker family. Here you go shark, let me fix your fin for you and sharpen your teeth while Im at it.  Bye bye.
Its simple, David would use that information to destroy them.
They could do better.
What?
Im not familiar with that expression,
It doesnt make sense, of course Im alive.
Michael, you have to. Have you ever seen a lioness devour its cub? Have you ever seen a baboon devour its mate?  Have you ever seen a raccoon devour a squirrel?
Your heart is a wonderful thing, Michael. But it has made some terrible decisions.
Yes.
Yeah.
Yeah, save your heart for love, and use your brain for business, right? If we dont do this to prince paper, someone else will. Worse yet, someone else will do it to us.
There was a terrible war, ugh, so many died. Far too many died. But if Frodo hadnt destroyed the ring, then goodness itself might have died.
Yeah.
Good, so,  where are you going?
Where are you taking the client list?
Michael, Michael, no. Michael, give that. Michael, dont do this. No.
Freeze, give me the list!
No no no, I cant let you do this!
Its business, not personal.
Its over, Michael, its over.
Guess whose stock just went up, golden boy?

Last week I gave a fire safety talk.  And nobody paid any attention.  Its my own fault for using PowerPoint.  PowerPoint is boring.  People learn in a lot of different ways, but experience is the best teacher.   Today, smoking is gonna save lives.
Does anyone smell anything smoky?
Oh, fire!  Oh my goodness!  Whats the procedure?  What do we do, people?
Oh, how did that happen?
No, we dont know that.  The smoke could be coming through an air duct.
Whats the procedure, everyone? Whats the procedure?
Wait, wait, wait.
No! No, Michael! No!  Touch the handle.  If its hot, there could be a fire in the hallway.
Not a viable option.
Okay, whats next?
Oh! Heres a door.  Check that one out. Hows the handle?
Well, uh, another option.
Back to our options. Jeez! Ok! settle down everyone.  No bunching!
Things can be replaced, Phyllis! People, human lives, however, can...
Okay, lets go.
Calm, please
Have you ever seen a burn victim?
Okay! Procedure, procedure. Exit options.  Where do we go folks?  Wha-- Use a what to cover the mouth?
A what?  A rag.  A damp rag, perhaps.  Lets remember those procedures.  What are the options?  Okay, thats the wrong way.  Weve already tried that.  Remember your exit points.  Exit points people.
Whats next?
How about 911?  Anyone? 911.
Use the surge of fear and adrenaline to sharpen your decision-making.
Attention everyone! Employees of Dunder Mifflin!  This has been a test of our emergency preparedness.  There is no fire.  It was only a simulation.
Fire not real.  This was merely a training exercise.  So, what have we learned?   Oh come on.  Its not real Stanley. Dont have a heart attack.
A lot of ideas were not appreciated in their time.
Shampoo.
I just want to say for the record, I did not kill anyone.  Stanley was attacked by his own heart. And he should be released from the hospital and back in the office in a couple days.
